Rise of Kannauj

After the decline of the Gupta Empire, the Maukharis established their power in the Gangetic plains and made Kannauj (Kanyakubja) the political center of North India. They were initially feudatories of the Guptas but became independent under Ishanvarman and Ishanavarman. Ishanvarman adopted the title 'Maharajadhiraja'.

тЪФя╕П
Conflict with Hunas and Guptas

The Maukharis played a significant role in preventing the Hunnic invaders from penetrating the interior of India. They also had continuous conflicts with the 'Later Guptas'.

ЁЯдЭ
Relationship with Harshavardhana

The last major ruler, Grihavarman, was married to Princess Rajyashri of the Pushyabhuti dynasty of Thanesar (sister of Harshavardhana). After the assassination of Grihavarman by the kings of Malwa and Gauda (Shashanka), the kingdom of Kannauj eventually merged into Harshavardhana's empire.
